MIRROR, MIRROR
by Barbara Sheridan

Emiko "Emmi" Maeda di=
dn't plan to spend the last summer vacation
before college kidnaping the fu=
ture Emperor of Japan. And she didn't
expect to be chased, attacked, or sed=
uced by sword wielding samurai or
put on the marriage market by an ancestor=
 who died a century before
she was born, but she was. And it all started wi=
th a shabby old mirror
she found after publicly humiliating herself...
